body_html:
@martinwicke Thanks for pointing out the Python 3 issue, it was a minor iteritems problem -- fixed it, hope Jenkins has six installed.

@martinwicke @ilblackdragon That actually raises a question -- is it possible to have tensorflow-devel compiled for both Py2 and Py3 in the same location? Or do I have to maintain two different locations on my machine if I want to test both? In my case I had it compiled for Py2 before, and had to reconfigure and rebuild for Py3 because bazel test --force_python=py3 --host_force_python=py3 --define PYTHON_BIN_PATH=/usr/local/bin/python3 //tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/datasets:synthetic_test was throwing a *.so Symbol not found error. Now I am rebuilding it back to Py2 because all my other scripts are using Py2.
body_text:

@martinwicke @ilblackdragon That actually raises a question -- is it possible to have tensorflow-devel compiled for both Py2 and Py3 in the same location? Or do I have to maintain two different locations on my machine if I want to test both? In my case I had it compiled for Py2 before, and had to reconfigure and rebuild for Py3 because bazel test --force_python=py3 --host_force_python=py3 --define PYTHON_BIN_PATH=/usr/local/bin/python3 //tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/datasets:synthetic_test was throwing a *.so Symbol not found error. Now I am rebuilding it back to Py2 because all my other scripts are using Py2.
body:
@martinwicke Thanks for pointing out the Python 3 issue, it was a minor `iteritems` problem -- fixed it, hope Jenkins has `six` installed.

@martinwicke @ilblackdragon That actually raises a question -- is it possible to have `tensorflow-devel` compiled for both Py2 and Py3 in the same location? Or do I have to maintain two different locations on my machine if I want to test both? In my case I had it compiled for Py2 before, and had to reconfigure and rebuild for Py3 because `bazel test --force_python=py3 --host_force_python=py3 --define PYTHON_BIN_PATH=/usr/local/bin/python3 //tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/datasets:synthetic_test` was throwing a `*.so Symbol not found` error. Now I am rebuilding it back to Py2 because all my other scripts are using Py2.
